meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'logy': sluggish or dull
meanings.sent1: After the long walk, I felt even logier than before.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather made everyone feel logier than usual.
meanings.sent3: The sloth in the zoo looked even logier than the lazy cat at home.
meanings.sent4: His mind felt logier than a computer running on low battery.
meanings.sent5: The old car moved even logier than a snail on a hot day.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'logy': lacking in energy or vitality
meanings.sent1: She seemed logier than usual after staying up all night.
meanings.sent2: The sick child appeared even logier than yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The logier puppy couldn't keep up with the energetic kittens.
meanings.sent4: His logier performance at work raised concerns about his health.
meanings.sent5: The logier plants in the shade struggled to grow as tall as the ones in the sun.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'logy': characterized by laziness or lethargy
meanings.sent1: The logier students in the back of the class struggled to stay awake.
meanings.sent2: His logier attitude towards chores annoyed his parents.
meanings.sent3: The logier sloth in the tree refused to move for hours.
meanings.sent4: Her logier pace during the race cost her the first-place trophy.
meanings.sent5: The logier cat lazily stretched out in the sun, ignoring the playful birds nearby.
